definition[0]: to treat someone unfairly by not giving them what they deserve or hoped for
example[0]: When the band only played for 15 minutes, the fans felt they had been short-changed.
definition[1]: to give back too little money to a customer who has bought something and paid more than the exact amount for it
definition[2]: to treat someone unfairly by cheating them or not giving them what they deserve
example[1]: The consumer is tired of being short-changed by cartels.
definition[3]: to give someone too little CHANGE (=money given back to someone when they have paid more than the exact price)
example[2]: I later discovered that the store had short-changed me by $10.
